qas.question: French forces tried to capture the liberal government based where?
Which two generals lost against the French on September 21, 1864?

answers.text: José María Patoni and Jesús González

qas.question: The goverment led by whom was forced to evacuate Saltillo?
Which was the last city through which Juarez evacuated?
Which governor led the supportive reception of President Juarez?

context: The French forces tried to subdue and capture the liberal government based in <a0_0>Saltillo<a0_0/>. On September 21, 1864, <a1_0>José María Patoni and Jesús González<a1_0/> Ortega lost against the French forces at the Battle of Estanzuelas; the supreme government led by <a2_0>President Juárez<a2_0/> was forced to evacuate the city of Saltillo and relocate to Chihuahua. Juárez stopped in Ciudad Jiménez, Valle de Allende, and Hidalgo de Parral, in turn. He decreed Parral the capital of Mexico from October 2–5, 1864. Perceiving the threat from the advancing French forces, the president continued his evacuation through Santa Rosalía de Camargo, Santa Cruz de Rosales, and finally <a3_0>Chihuahua, Chihuahua<a3_0/>. On October 12, 1864, the people of the state gave President Juárez an overwhelmingly supportive reception, led by Governor <a4_0>Ángel Trías<a4_0/>. On October 15, 1864 the city of Chihuahua was declared the temporary capital of Mexico.
